meanings.definition: To sit or stand with one leg on either side of something.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy would straddle the horse before riding off into the sunset.
meanings.sent2: I often straddle the fence when making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The acrobat tried to straddle two horses at once, but it didn't end well.
meanings.sent4: She had to straddle the line between work and personal life.
meanings.sent5: He straddled the bike, ready to pedal away.

meanings.definition: To be on both sides of or cover a wide range of things.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to straddle different issues to appeal to all voters.
meanings.sent2: The bridge straddles the river, connecting two towns.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to straddle two boxes at the same time, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: Her responsibilities straddle multiple departments in the company.
meanings.sent5: The tree's branches seemed to straddle the entire yard.

meanings.definition: An act of sitting or standing with one leg on either side of something.
meanings.sent1: The child's favorite playground activity was the straddle on the balance beam.
meanings.sent2: Her straddle over the fence was impressive to watch.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor demonstrated the straddle pose to the class.
meanings.sent4: The gymnast's straddle during the routine earned her a high score.
meanings.sent5: The straddle in gymnastics requires flexibility and balance.
